result.execSummary:
The defendant Codi L Klismith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs. Pay DNA Surcharge.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF-297.
If Defendant successfully completes probation, Court will consider Expungment on both of the files.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Codi L Klismith in court with attorney William David Mansell. Defendant Codi L Klismith in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF297 and 14CF263.

1:43 p.m  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Court questions Atty Mansell as to what the issue is.
Atty Mansell makes statements regarding his client being able to be put on electronic monitoring.
Court verifies the jail time for the defendant; Atty Mansell would like his client to be put on the electronic monitoring.
Atty Cousins states that one of the victim's is in the courtroom today and objects to any of the time being served on electronic monitoring for the defendant.
Atty Cousins would refer this back to the Court if the defendant could be put on electronic monitoring.
Court makes statements regarding the electronic monitoring system and the process.

BY THE COURT:
Court will allow 60 days in jail and 60 days on home detention with huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Hearing at 07-09-2015 01:30 pm
Response letter from Judge
from Atty Mansell
Statement Regarding Recusal

Defendant Codi L Klismith in court with attorney William David Mansell. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-263 and 14CF-297.

11:03 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Court has received a copy of the PSI.
State received a copy.
Atty Mansell also received a copy, states corrections for the record.

Court received an independed PSI from Atty Mansell on April 8th.
Atty Cousins received a copy of this.

Atty Mansell states there is no reason why this client shouldn't be sentenced today.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
14CF-297 - withheld, 3 yrs probation, with conditions listed, Do not sell any items on line, 180 days jail
14CF-263 - probation concurrent to 14CF-297

Atty Mansell addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court reviews the files.
Court feels probation is appropriate with conditional jail time.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-297:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 3 Years
Conditions:
Jail sentence for 120 Days
Huber granted for school or work and any other counseling
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
No contact with co defendants Johnathan Crossman, Evan Beck, Gary Henley or juvenile co defendants
No contact with victims
Cmply with all assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by teh Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections
Restitution joint and several:
-Richard Marshall joint and several with Crossman, Henley and Beck - $768.42
-Erie Insurance joint and several with Crossman, Henley and Beck - $1,721.75
-Charles Reichl joint and several with Crossman, Henley and Beck - $207.49
-Robert Tishim joint and several with Crossman,  Henley and Beck -  $83
-Donald Bellinger joint and several with Crossman, Henley and Beck - $383.51
-Wayne Weiler joint and several with Henley and Beck - $45
Pay costs, to be paid after restitution
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination of both to equal full time
Provide DNA Sample
Pay DNA surcharge
Write letters of apology to the victims
Not to sell any items on line such as on Craigs List

14CF-263:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 1  Year concurrent to 14CF-297
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 14CF-297
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

If Defendant successfully completes probation, Court will consider Expungment on both of the files

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Codi L Klismith in court with attorney William David Mansell. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF263, 14CF297

10:35 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Moves to amend 14CF263 Count 1 to 944.20(1) Class A Misdemeanor. Will file an amended information later. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

BY THE COURT:  
Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF297 Count 3 - NO CONTEST
14CF263 as amended - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.

Clerk informs the court an additional subsection needs to be added to the amended charge. 
Court questions parties if they are in agreement to add subsection b.
Parties concur. 

Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF297 Count 3 and 14CF263 as amended.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in are: 14CF297 Counts 1, 2, 4 thru 13.
Court orders a PSI. 

Atty Cousins makes statements re: filing a Victim Impact Statement. 
Court has placed that in the file.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on January 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Atty Mansell
Pre-trial conference on October 20, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Pretrial today.
Bond Continued.
Arraignment on September 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Case was scheduled to be heard in Br 2, but was moved to Br 3.
Defendant Codi L Klismith in court with attorney William D. Mansell. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
